EmptyNode - JS.description: An empty Node.js function without triggers, inputs, or outputs

body: context.log('Node.js eventhub trigger function processed work item', myEventHubTrigger);

GithubWebhook - JS.description: A Node.js function that will be run whenever it receives a GitHub webhook request

HttpGET(CRUD) - JS.description: A Node.js function that fetches entities from a Storage Table when it receives an HTTP request

HttpPOST(CRUD) - JS.description: A Node.js function that adds entities to a Storage Table when it receives an HTTP request

body: context.log('Node.js HTTP trigger function processed a request. RequestUri=%s', req.originalUrl);
body: "Please pass a name on the query string or in the request body"
HttpTrigger - JS.description: A Node.js function that will be run whenever it receives an HTTP request

body: context.log('Node.js manually triggered function called with input:', input);
ManualTrigger - JS.description: A Node.js function that is triggered manually via the portal "Run" button

body: context.log('Node.js queue trigger function processed work item', myQueueItem);
QueueTrigger - JS.description: A Node.js function that will be run whenever a message is added to a specified Azure Storage queue

body: context.log('Node.js SaaS trigger function processed a file!');
SaaSFileTrigger - JS.description: A Node.js function that will be run whenever a file is added to a SaaS provider.

body: context.log('Node.js ServiceBus topic trigger function processed message', mySbMsg);
ServiceBusTopicTrigger - JS.description: A Node.js function that will be run whenever a message is added to the specified Service Bus topic

TimerTrigger - JS.description: A Node.js function that will be run on a specified schedule
